author: Special Correspondent
text:
Ahead of a possible meeting with Union Environment Minister Prakash Javadekar, DMDK president Vijayakant on Saturday chaired a meeting of party district secretaries at his Koyambedu office.

DMDK sources though were tight-lipped about the agenda of the meeting, though they confirmed that electoral alliance was discussed. A few who emerged out of the meeting said the official line the party had directed them to take was that the meeting was to prepare for a women’s wing rally.

BJP sources said Mr. Javadekar is scheduled to meet Mr. Vijayakant on Sunday. He met minor partners like the IJK on Saturday and held brief discussions.

A senior leader said BJP national president Amit Shah had consented to participate in a public meeting in Tiruchi in the second week of March. “He wants the alliance talks completed by then and hopes to see alliance leaders on the stage with him,” the leader said.

It is also learnt that senior BJP leader and Union Minister Venkaiah Naidu who is also in town, may join Mr. Javadekar.
title: Vijayakant chairs meeting of district secretaries
